intro: Chaetanthera glabrata, commonly known as the smooth chaetanthera, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture, while the stems are smooth and slender. Chaetanthera glabrata is often found in open grasslands and is known for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal practices.
